hint.text:
Try writing the given information in the form of an equation, with the required number as an unknown.
\(a^m\times a^n = a^{(m+n)}\)
\(a^m\times b^m=(a\times b)^m\)
\((a^m)^n=a^{(m\times n)}\)
\(\frac{a^m}{a^n}=a^{(m-n)}\)
\(a^0=1\)

solution.text:
Lets say that \( -(_{k}_)^{-2} \) is multiplied by y to give \( \frac {1}{4 \times _{k}_^{2}} \)
Hence, \( -(_{k}_)^{-2} \times y = \frac {1}{4 \times _{k}_^2} \)
\( \Rightarrow \frac {-1}{_{k}_^2} \times y = \frac {1}{4 \times _{k}_^2} \)
Multiplying both sides by \( (_{k}_)^{2} \) we get,
\( \Rightarrow -1 \times y = \frac {1}{4} \)
\( \Rightarrow y = \frac {-1}{4}=-0.25 \)

content.text: By what number should \( -(_{k}_)^{-2} \)  be multiplied to get \( \frac {1}{4 \times _{k}_^{2}} \)?
